item.title: Why the millennials matter
item.author: Rene Schuster, rene.schuster@telefonica.com
item.description: Dear colleagues, today I attended this year's ZEIT Conference in Berlin. I discussed with young entrepreneurs and experts in personal management how the digital generation changes our world. Who is this digital generation? Millennials grew up at the start of our digital world. This digital revolution - the breakthrough of the mobile Internet, of smartphones, tablets and Social Media - has been the biggest technology watershed since the invention of the computer. And it is profoundly shaping businesses and our markets in particular: Millenials today account for 88 million of our customers worldwide. And they are technology trendsetters. Getting in touch with friends all over the world anytime and anywhere, having access to an infinite pool of information and digital services - what's natural for millennials becomes more and more habitual for other generations as well. item.title: Messaging-services outdistance SMS
item.author: Rene Schuster, rene.schuster@telefonica.com
item.description: Hi colleagues, OTT companies have launched new products and services that are attacking our classical products and services - just think of Whatsapp, iMessage, or the new Facebook Messenger. A study published a few days ago underlines radical change in customer behavior: According Informa, daily OTT messaging traffic has already overtaken daily SMS traffic. An average of 19 billion OTT messages are sent per day in 2012, compared with an average of around 17 billion SMS messages. And this trend is set to continue, the study highlights: The volume of OTT messaging traffic is set to be twice that of SMS by the end of the year. By the end of 2013, the study estimates that 41 billion OTT messages will be sent every day, compared with an average of about 19 billion SMS messages. This shows how rapidly the market is changing. item.title: Our first quarterly results as a listed company
item.author: Rene Schuster, rene.schuster@telefonica.com
item.description: Dear colleagues, After the exciting day at the Frankfurt Stock Exchange last week, we can celebrate our next premiere today: Our first presentation of quarterly results as a listed company! The results are strong and underline our successful growth story. And by the way: They match the development of our stock price since the first day - which looks pretty good. Compared to Q3 / 2011, we added 10.3% more contract customers. The prepaid business also continued to grow, doubling its new customers compared with the previous quarter. Overall, we generated a healthy OIBDA growth of 12.5% compared to the third quarter of last year. Wireless service revenue increased 5.6 percent compared with the third quarter of 2011 to reach 812 million euro - here we are number three in the market! Successful mobile data strategy Our mobile data strategy remains the key driver of our success: Mobile data revenue grew by 28.3%.
